result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Berlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with Sam's Club listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Resitution is to be determined.
AMENDED 05-06-2016:  Restitution is set at zero ($0).

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.
Court will allow to be served in Milwaukee County.

Defendant James A Berlin in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  

Parties have agreed that restitution be set at $0.00.

Court orders restitution be set at $0.00.

Restitution hearing on May 6, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Letter by the Defendant, received and filed in court.

Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James A Berlin in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.



Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
STAYED.
 
Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Sam's Club listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Requested RESTITUTION:  $641.24 (to be paid Sam's Club listed in the complaint - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Defense is contesting that amount and requests the matter be scheduled for a restitution hearing.
Restitution hearing will be scheduled.


Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


CONDITION TIME:
 30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James A Berlin in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  
Jury Trial Cancelled.

State moves to amend from a Felony to a Misdemeanor.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.

Matter put over for Sentencing and Restitution.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Jury status hearing at 01-07-2016 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person at 01-12-2016 08:30 am.

Order Denying - Defense Motion Challenging Sufficiency of the Prelim.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 10/14/15.

Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James A Berlin in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  
Motion filed by Defense - Challenging sufficiency of the Preliminary Hearing (requesting matter be dismissed).

Atty. Hartley presented arguments to the court.
State presented arguments to the court.
Response presented.

Court finds/order the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
Court agrees that this may be an inappropriate charge.
However, the court finds there is sufficiency for a bind over at prelim.
Therefore, Court Denies - Defense Motion Challenging Sufficiency of the Prelim.
  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Hearing on August 31, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant James A Berlin in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Scott Hibler from the Town of Brookfield was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. Testimony is closed. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
